problem_text:
a) Let α be a fixed-point-free automorphism of prime order p of a periodic group G. Is it true that G does not contain a non-trivial p-element?
V. D. Mazurov
answer: a) No, it may contain a non-trivial p-element (E. B. Durakov, A. I. Sozutov, Algebra Logic, 52, no. 5 (2013), 422–425).
